Idioms.definition: Which means, energetic labour, especially in the polishing of household items.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for drunk.
Which means, the primary performer has left. There's no point waiting around.
Which means, euphemism for torture.
Which means, the singling out and killing of a specific ethnic group.

Idioms.phrase: Every cloud has a silver lining
Idioms.definition: Which means, an encouragement to be optimistic. Even bad events have a good side to them.
Which means, everything imaginable.

Which means, an imaginary double, humorously referred to in order to explain the uncharacteristic bad behaviour of a normally moral person. Usually used light-heartedly. The expression formed as an allusion to plots in films involving actual evil twins.
Which means, please forgive me for swearing.
Which means, something that creates shock or surprise.
Which means, the jack queen or king in a set of playing cards.
Which means, accept he unwelcome consequences of one's own actions.
Which means, rearing livestock under industrial conditions.
Which means, a happy simplistic ending to a story similar to those found in fairy tales.
Which means, very different from.
Which means, a frantic competition or exploitation - like a group shark attack.

Idioms.phrase: Fell off the back of a lorry
Idioms.definition: Which means, a coy reference to an item that has been stolen.
Which means, a day noted for remarkable or exciting events.
Which means, an exclamation meaning 1. Nonsense; rubbish. 2. An indication of mild annoyance.
Which means, to become conscious of and develop one's expertise.
Which means, inspire with enthusiasm.
Which means, the most senior person in a group of equal rank.
Which means, making a round of visits at New Year.
Which means, a relatively trivial problem only affecting the affluent.
Which means, the industrialised affluent and wealthy nations.
Which means, unwilling to change from your habitual way of doing things.
Which means, a market used to buy and sell inexpensive goods. The kind of place that might sell carpets infested with fleas.
Which means, a downmarket cinema - allegedly verminous.
Which means, 1 - One's family. 2 - the bodily stuff we are made of.
Which means, to aggressively raise your middle finger at someone as a sign of displeasure.
Which means, to attempt to make progress with something that has no future.
Which means, assorted bits and pieces of rubbish; especially items that are found in the sea.
Which means, to show vehement rage.
Which means, chaotic collective behaviour where items of food are thrown about wildly.
Which means, something that appears valuable but really isn't, like iron pyrites - a worthless mineral that resembles gold.
Which means, wear a smart or formal dress for a special occasion.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for road.
Which means, an old-fashioned and foolish type of person.
Which means, everything possible. The whole thing.
Which means, talking hot air.
Which means, a mental hospital.
Which means, childish term for a horse.
Which means, a person who adopts a deliberately androgynous appearance, by use of uni-sex make-up, hair-style and clothing. Probably influenced by 'bender' being an earlier slang term for homosexual.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for daft.
Which means, earn a merit point for doing well.
Which means, concern yourself with the basic and important realities.

Idioms.phrase: Get off on the wrong foot
Idioms.definition: Which means, make a bad start in a relationship or task.
Which means, accept and participate with an idea or project.
Which means, become chaotic and uncontrollable.

Idioms.phrase: Get out of the wrong side of the bed
Idioms.definition: Which means,
Which means, move beyond something that is bothering you.
Which means, understand something, especially something difficult to comprehend because it is complex or surprising.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for queer.

Idioms.phrase: Give him an inch and he'll take a mile
Idioms.definition: Which means, allow someone a small concession and they will take advantage and try to take more.

Idioms.phrase: Give the benefit of the doubt
Idioms.definition: Which means, decide to believe a statement which isn't proven.
Which means, to get away from. To escape.
Which means, an unacknowledged or unseen discriminatory barrier that prevents women and minorities from rising to positions of power.
Which means, a very small (imaginary) unit of measurement.
Which means, become excessively agitated and excited.
Which means, become badly and permanently inoperative.
Which means, put every resource into getting a particular result.
Which means, take a risk to support someone or something.
Which means, going beyond what is usually required. Make an extra effort.

Idioms.phrase: Going to hell in a handbasket
Idioms.definition: Which means, deteriorating and headed for complete disaster.
Which means, someone who compassionately helps another who is in need.
Which means, working hours that extend overnight.
Which means, a small cheap cafe selling fried food.
Which means, said ironically when two people have matching thoughts.
Which means, exclamation of surprise.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for neck.
Which means, a personal intuition, based on feeling rather than fact.
Which means, to have been successful during a military campaign.

Which means, an alcoholic drink, intended to cure a hangover. It is mistakenly believed that a small measure of the same drink that made a person drunk will sober them up and cure the drinks ill effects. The expression is also used in other contexts, whenever an additional dose of whatever caused a problem is thought to be an appropriate remedy.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for pinch.
Which means, a bittersweet feeling combining both happiness and sadness.
Which means, brand spanking new.

Idioms.phrase: Has the cat got your tongue?
Idioms.definition: Which means, a question addressed to someone who is inexplicably silent. The implication is that the person's tongue is missing.
Which means, doing things in a rush makes for a poor result.
Which means, a threefold feat in sports or some other activity.
Which means, have an especially good time.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for look.

Idioms.phrase: He makes my flesh (or skin) crawl (or creep)
Idioms.definition: Which means, said of someone who the speaker has a deep dislike of.
Which means, very excited, especially when in love.
Which means, hear rumors about something from an anonymous informal contact.
Which means, a state of nervous anxiety or fear.
Which means, determined to achieve something at all costs.
Which means, invitation to take something freely.
Which means, something that defies apprehension by being too obvious.
Which means, proud and arrogant.
Which means, luxurious.
Which means, the most popular time to visit a resort or attraction - when prices are highest.
Which means, to study, especially for a test or exam.
Which means,

Idioms.phrase: Hit the nail on the head
Idioms.definition: Which means, make the precise correct point.
Which means, retire to bed.
Which means, 1. A choice forced upon someone. 2. Cockney rhyming slang for voice.
Which means, a term used to denote magic or trickery.
Which means, be patient.
Which means, an expression of extreme surprise or disbelief.

Idioms.phrase: I can't be doing with it
Idioms.definition: Which means, i am unwilling to tolerate it.
Which means, i'm overwhelmed and stressed and it is affecting my ability to think.
